channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Tottenham boss Frank confident of owners' backing
item.description: Tottenham manager Thomas Frank is "very confident" he has the backing of the club's owners despite his side's lacklustre league showing.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v Tailenders host Felix White
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Felix White - and AI - with his predictions for the midweek Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Onana left out of Cameroon Afcon squad & coach sacked
item.description: Andre Onana is one of several high-profile players left out of Cameroon's Africa Cup of Nations squad, as federation president Samuel Eto'o sacks the manager just weeks before the tournament.

item.title: Maccabi fan ban evidence 'changed to fit decision'
item.description: West Midlands Police chiefs are providing evidence to MPs about the decision to ban Israeli fans.

item.title: Video fallout brought me closer to team-mates - Fernandez
item.description: Chelsea midfielder Enzo Fernandez says his relationship with his team-mates was strengthened by the way he dealt with the fallout from posting a "racist and discriminatory" video on social media.

item.title: Sheff Wed deducted six more points as Chansiri banned
item.description: Sheffield Wednesday are given a further six-point deduction, with former owner Dejphon Chansiri receiving a three-year ban.

item.title: Why Caicedo was sent off but Bentancur escaped
item.description: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca is frustrated by Moises Caicedo's red card against Arsenal over what he perceives to be a lack of consistency.

item.title: Trafford wants to leave Man City - Tuesday's gossip
item.description: James Trafford eyes Manchester City exit, Jean-Philippe Mateta is wanted by AC Milan, Atletico Madrid are ready to sell Conor Gallagher, plus more.

item.title: Could Merino be Arsenal's number nine?
item.description: Arsenal's draw with Chelsea was not their best performance of the season but the sight of Mikel Merino wheeling away after scoring an important goal has become a familiar welcome sight for the Gunners.

item.title: Fisk injury depletes England options in defence
item.description: Liverpool captain Grace Fisk is unavailable for England's final friendly match of the year after picking up a "small calf injury" in training.

item.title: Liverpool put end to losing run with win against West Ham
item.description: Alexander Isak scores his first Premier League goal for Liverpool as Arne Slot's side end their losing run with a 2-0 win away at West Ham.

item.title: Ten-man Chelsea hold Arsenal to draw in feisty derby
item.description: Chelsea produce a defiant performance to hold Premier League leaders Arsenal to a 1-1 draw at Stamford Bridge after going down to 10 men following Moises Caicedo's first-half dismissal.

item.title: Zirkzee and Mount help Man Utd secure comeback victory at Palace
item.description: Joshua Zirkzee breaks his 12-month Premier League goal drought before Mason Mount fires in from a well worked free-kick as Manchester United secure a second-half comeback victory against Crystal Palace.

item.title: Kamara stunner wins derby for Villa over Wolves
item.description: Boubacar Kamara scores a stunning goal to fire Aston Villa to third in the Premier League after a gritty 1-0 derby win over Wolves at Villa Park.

item.title: Brighton beat Nottingham Forest to go fifth in the table
item.description: Brighton beat Nottingham Forest 2-0 with goals from Maxim De Cuyper and Stefanos Tzimas to go fifth in the Premier League table.

item.title: 'Why would you do that?' - Sutton on Spurs fans booing
item.description: The Monday Night Club's Chris Sutton and Rory Smith discuss whether Tottenham Hotspur fans should be booing their own players.

item.title: Ajax abandon match due to fireworks
item.description: Ajax are forced to halt their Dutch League match against Groningen and later abandon due to supporters igniting fireworks and flares.

item.title: Positive signs, but Isak at Liverpool still a 'work in progress'
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer says that Alexander Isak is showing positive signs but still needs to work on his connection with his Liverpool team-mates.

item.title: How 'sensational' James helped Chelsea stop Arsenal
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Micah Richards analyses how Reece James produced a "sensational" midfield performance to help 10-man Chelsea hold Premier League leaders Arsenal to a 1-1 draw at Stamford Bridge.

item.title: 'Mo will be important for us' - Slot defends dropping Salah
item.description: Arne Slot defends his pre-match decision to bench Mohamed Salah following Liverpool's 2-0 win over West Ham.

item.title: 'Arsenal deserve to be clear - but who's best placed to challenge?'
item.description: MOTD pundit Alan Shearer explains where Chelsea and the rest of the chasing pack need to improve if they are going to challenge Premier League leaders Arsenal.

item.title: Nancy will take charge of Celtic this week - O'Neill
item.description: Wilfried Nancy will be in the Celtic dugout for Sunday's Scottish Premiership match against Hearts, according to interim manager Martin O'Neill.

item.title: Silva's son signs first pro contract with Chelsea
item.description: Isago Silva, son of ex-Brazil defender Thiago Silva, has signed his first professional contract with his father's former club Chelsea.

item.title: Mateta's Crystal Palace contract talks stall
item.description: Crystal Palace striker Jean-Philippe Mateta's long-term future is uncertain as talks stall over a new contract.

item.title: 'A reflection of what I've endured' - Paqueta on Liverpool red card
item.description: West Ham midfielder Lucas Paqueta says his red card in the 2-0 defeat by Liverpool was a "reflection of everything I've had to endure" following spot-fixing investigation.

item.title: How Amorim's half-time tweaks turned game around for Man Utd
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer gives Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim credit for how his side improved their "effort" and "commitment" in the second half to secure a 2-1 comeback victory against Crystal Palace.

item.title: Maresca praises 'outstanding' Chelsea response to Caicedo red card
item.description: Manager Enzo Maresca praises Chelsea's "outstanding" response to claim a 1-1 Premier League draw against leaders Arsenal at Stamford Bridge after midfielder Moises Caicedo was sent off in the first half.

item.title: Arteta 'disappointed, but proud' to draw against 10-man Chelsea
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says he is "disappointed" that his side drew against Chelsea after the Blues went down to 10 men in the first half, but also "proud" of his team for how they responded after a "massive" week of football.

item.title: 'January window is too late' - Glasner hits out at frugal Palace
item.description: Crystal Palace manger Oliver Glasner believes the club should have spent more in the summer given their European commitments, arguing that January is too late to bolster his squad.

item.title: Zirkzee influence 'massive' for Man Utd - Amorim
item.description: Ruben Amorim praises Joshua Zirkzee after the striker scored in a 2-1 comeback win at Crystal Palace.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: 'Is this the start of Liverpool's life without Salah?'
item.description: Is this the start of Liverpool's life without Mohamed Salah after he was dropped for the 2-0 win at West Ham, asks chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: Is Aberdeen revival recipe for success or unsustainable?
item.description: A fourth 1-0 win in six league games has revived Aberdeen's fortunes - can Jimmy Thelin's shot-shy side keep up the momentum?

item.title: 'Learning point' as Arsenal miss chance to extend lead
item.description: Arsenal complete a tough week with a draw at Chelsea, but Mikel Arteta feels the Gunners "should and could have" won at Stamford Bridge.

item.title: Match-winner Mount's quality 'never in doubt'
item.description: Mason Mount scores Manchester United's winner at Crystal Palace and completes his first 90 minutes for the visitors in the Premier League.

item.title: How Villa have relied on record number of long-range goals
item.description: Aston Villa have scored a higher percentage of their goals from outside the box than any side in Premier League history.

item.title: Spain want to 'dedicate victory' to injured Bonmati
item.description: Spain manager Sonia Bermudez says her side want to retain their Women's Nations League title for injured midfielder Aitana Bonmati.

item.title: SFA seals multi-million Hampden naming rights deal
item.description: The Scottish FA announces a "multi-million-pound, long-term partnership" with Barclays for the naming rights of the national stadium.

item.title: 'Clear picture' emerging as Rohl's Rangers stumble
item.description: Danny Rohl says Rangers progressed since his arrival, but supporters might argue otherwise after another drab home draw.

item.title: Ajax criticise 'outrageous' fireworks after match abandoned
item.description: Ajax criticise the "utterly outrageous" firework display which resulted in their Dutch league match against Groningen being abandoned.

item.title: Which club has the most red cards in a Premier League season?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything looks at the record for most red cards in a Premier League season

item.title: Celtic face sixth-tier Auchinleck Talbot in Scottish Cup
item.description: Last season's beaten Scottish Cup finalists Celtic are drawn away to West of Scotland League Premier Division side Auchinleck Talbot in the fourth round, while defending champions Aberdeen start their defence at home against Championship side Raith Rovers.

item.title: 'Bonds the embodiment of West Ham's spirit'
item.description: Billy Bonds, who has died at the age of 79, was one of the greatest players ever to represent West Ham United and one of the finest never to win a full England cap, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: Mistakes cost Forest but Dyche can't question players
item.description: Sean Dyche says that despite mistakes costing his side, he can't question their second-half performance against Brighton & Hove Albion.

item.title: 'I need to speak to him' - Nuno confused by Paqueta dismissal
item.description: West Ham United manager Nuno Espirito Santo says he need to speak to Lucas Paqueta to understand why he refused to stop talking to referee Darren England until the midfielder was shown back-to-back yellow cards for dissent.

item.title: Villa 'resilience' key to victory - Emery
item.description: Aston Villa boss Unai Emery says he is delighted with his side's ability to remain patient after they ground out a 1-0 win over Wolves at Villa Park.

item.title: How fantastic Foden got Man City 'out of jail'
item.description: Match of the Day's Joe Hart analyses how Phil Foden made the Etihad Stadium "his dancefloor", scoring twice - including a late winner - in Manchester City's 3-2 victory against Leeds United.

item.title: Analysis: Vicario mistake heaps more pressure on Frank
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Joe Hart and Danny Murphy analyse Guglielmo Vicario's mistake for Tottenham that allowed Fulham's Harry Wilson to produce "a piece of art" and increase the pressure on Spurs manager Thomas Frank.

item.title: Palace 'threw away' chance of better season with lack of signings - Glasner
item.description: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner criticises the clubs failure to reinforce the squad over the summer in order to be competitive with the addition of European football.

item.title: Inside return to form of Chelsea's 'fantastic' James
item.description: The 25-year-old played in midfield in a sensational performance against Arsenal just four days after a similarly impressive display at home to Barcelona.

item.title: Law change considered for keeper tactical timeouts
item.description: A move to force teams to temporarily remove an outfield player if a goalkeeper goes down injured is being discussed by football's lawmakers in an effort to combat sides using a loophole to create a "tactical timeout".

item.title: How Viking ended 34-year Norwegian title drought
item.description: Viking FK wrap up their first Norwegian league title in 34 years, sparking big celebrations in the city of Stavanger. BBC Sport takes a look at their achievement.

item.title: Speaking backwards and a manager at 13 - the Solskjaer story
item.description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer discusses Manchester United, the career he'd have chosen if he wasn't in football, and the team he'd like to manage.

item.title: Lionesses impress - but did Wiegman learn much?
item.description: England fans could not have hoped for a more entertaining evening at Wembley Stadium - but with Sarina Wiegman resisting the urge to be more experimental, how much did she actually learn from it?

item.title: Ronaldo's World Cup reprieve - special treatment or justified?
item.description: Has Fifa given Cristiano Ronaldo special treatment to get the star player to the 2026 World Cup finals, or have we seen this happen before?

item.title: 'Start believing the hype' - how 'effortless' Estevao outshone Yamal
item.description: Estevao Willian outshone fellow wonderkid Lamine Yamal with a wondergoal on Tuesday - so is it "time to start believing the hype"?

item.title: Have Premier League's most expensive signings been successful?
item.description: Which of the Premier League's most expensive signings can be considered a success, or a failure, relative to their achievements?

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Who is one card away from suspension in the Premier League?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at who is currently nearing a suspension in the Premier League.

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign

item.title: A European giant - but what's happened to the modern-day Ajax?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains the demise of Ajax in recent years and whether their fortunes could be about to change

item.title: When were Coventry last in the Premier League?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team take a look at when Coventry City were last in the Premier League and their chances of promotion.

item.title: Why are there 12pm and 2:05pm kick-offs in Premier League on Sunday?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why four kick-offs on Sunday have unusual start times

item.title: Why are Man Utd not playing on a Saturday for two months?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains why Manchester United are not playing on a Saturday for two months

item.title: Who is not going to the 2026 World Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at which countries and players will not be competing at the 2026 World Cup

item.title: Rohl issues warning to Rangers players - gossip
item.description: Rangers head coach warns players as views are expressed over incidents in Celtic's win at Hibs.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: The rise of Bayern's 'special' teen Karl who 'plays Messi style'
item.description: In less than 12 months, Lennart Karl has progressed from youth football to the Champions League - and is in contention for a World Cup spot. BBC Sport charts the Bayern Munich teenager's rise.

item.title: Van Persie gives son debut 'as a coach - not as a dad'
item.description: After Shaqueel van Persie was given his senior debut by his father Robin, BBC Sport picks out other father-son duos in football.

item.title: BBC secures rights to show La Liga clips until 2027
item.description: BBC Sport has secures the rights to show La Liga highlights in the UK in a deal which runs until 2027.

item.title: 'It would be the biggest middle finger' - Chilwell eyes World Cup
item.description: Ben Chilwell is keen to show he can go from the Chelsea 'bomb squad' to England's World Cup squad thanks to his move to Strasbourg.

item.title: Five things to look out for in Lionesses friendlies
item.description: England will end another successful year with two friendly matches - but what changes might we see from manager Sarina Wiegman?

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
